==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|じょ|おう|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょおう'}} compound {{m|zh|女王|tr=nrjo<sup>X</sup> hjwang|lit=female + king}}. The [[漢音#Japanese|''kan'on'']] reading, so likely a later borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=ko|じょ.おう|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じょ.おう|hhira=ぢよわう}}

# a [[queen regnant]]

=====See also=====
* {{ja-r|王|おう|[[king]]}}
* {{ja-r|王%妃|おう%ひ|[[queen consort]]}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=しょうおう'}}
Alteration of ''joō''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=i|じょうおう|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|じょう.おう|hhira=ぢようわう}}

# a [[queen regnant]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|にょ|おう|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=にょおう}} compound {{m|zh|女王|tr=nrjo<sup>X</sup> hjwang|lit=female + king}}. The [[呉音#Japanese|''goon'']] reading, so likely the initial borrowing.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=go|にょ.おう|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|にょ.おう|hhira=によわう}}

# a [[queen regnant]]
